evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: 1.  Plaintiff Mayor and City Council of Baltimore, Maryland (“Baltimore”) is a municipal corporation, organized pursuant to Articles XI and XI-A of the Maryland Constitution, entrusted with all the powers of local self-government and home rule afforded by those articles. Baltimore is the largest city in Maryland and the thirteenth largest city in the United States.

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Mayor and City Council of Baltimore, Maryland (‘Baltimore’)

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: 2.  Plaintiff Economic Action Maryland Fund (“Economic Action”) is a statewide nonprofit movement of individuals and organizations that advances economic inclusion and financial justice through research, advocacy, consumer education, and direct service. Its direct service programs support Maryland households struggling in housing, economic security, medical debt, and more.

extracted.value: Plaintiff: Economic Action Maryland Fund (‘Economic Action’)

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: 3.  Defendant Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (“CFPB”) is a federal financial regulatory agency headquartered in Washington, D.C. It is charged with administering federal consumer protection laws and regulating a broad swath of consumer financial products and services.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: 4.  Defendant Russell Vought is the Acting Director of the CFPB. He is sued in his official capacity.

extracted.value: Defendant: Russell Vought (Acting Director of the CFPB)
